jobs.title: Front End Engineer
description: Develop fully responsive user interfaces for client projects of various sizes
Formalize code standards for the development team
Assess and optimize production build processes

jobs.title: UI Development Lead
description: UI lead in the development of a fully responsive internal content management web application to support TalentBrew, TMP’s core recruitment marketing software platform

Key driver behind a move to fully responsive development within the organization, coordinating a month-long intensive responsive design training program for over 70 designers and copywriters in 8 offices across 3 countries
Assessed feasibility of new feature implementations through prototyping, and aided in both development and documentation of new product enhancements
Regularly reviewed site proposals for accessibility and web standards compliance, as well as ability to translate fluidly to the responsive web
Actively promoted web standards, mobile-first development, and use of new technology across all departments

jobs.title: UI/Front End Developer
description: User interface development for corporate recruitment websites and internal content management systems
Consultant on accessibility standards and development best practices for software development team
Building out sites according to client branding guidelines and business rules for functionality, while upholding web standards
Developing fully responsive site templates using mobile-first programming strategies
Actively promoting web standards and development best practices across among both developers and non-technical team members
Maintaining documentation for new products and site features
Coordinating and executing responsive development training sessions for design teams in multiple offices across the United States
Working with project managers to troubleshoot websites and modify templates according to client requests

jobs.title: Marketing Intern - Muhlenberg College
description: Worked with marketing team to develop advertising campaigns for events and initiatives to increase student interactivity with Dining Services social media outlets
Established style guide to maintain consistency in design across multiple dining locations
Regularly updated Facebook pages of both Muhlenberg and other regional colleges/universities
Created Facebook sidebar application template for campus dining menus and locations, currently used district-wide
Scripted, filmed, and edited video of annual Chef’s Fair to use as promotional material
Food styling, photography, and layout for monthly nutrition newsletter

jobs.title: Web Consultant, ABE Department
description: Developed a web interface and related content with the goal of enhancing the relevance of the present website to both current and incoming students in the Accounting, Business, Economics, and Finance Departments
Facebook and Google Calendar integration for future event promotion, including providing guidelines for social media marketing to faculty

jobs.title: Graphic/Web Design, Senior Year Experience
description: Migrated web content to new template as part of a college-wide web upgrade
Generated text and images on a weekly basis to reflect seasonal themes and upcoming programs

Designed print and web campaign (including brochures, posters, YouTube commercials, and web page) encouraging seniors to register for the annual “Reality MC” weekend seminar on transitioning out of college
Covered events spanning the 2011 “Senior Week” and compiled video footage into a 2-minute synopsis highlighting the importance of inter-departmental cooperation in organizing the week’s programs

jobs.title: Research Assistant
description: Worked on projects for both the History (January 2009 - May 2009, January 2010 to May 2010) and Media & Communication (September 2010 - January 2011) departments
Performed preliminary reviews of academic research on the subject of audience analysis
Designed original and re-created existing infographics to illustrate important concepts related to audience analysis
Previewed and catalogued historical films on Latin America
Developed system of data entry for cataloguing historical film revenue data

jobs.title: Social Networking Intern
jobs.company: Greater Lehigh Valley Chamber of Commerce
description: Analyzed data on Twitter and blog posts to determine most popular topics, peak daily viewership times, and effectiveness of passive versus active verbiage in attracting users to click links
Conducted extensive research on social media use for business
Wrote regular blog posts on new web tools for business organization and analytics
